revised_title: Awards and Achievements in Science: 1962 Royal Society Honorees
tldr: The President of the Royal Society, Sir Howard Florey, presents an address at the Anniversary Meeting, highlighting the achievements and contributions of various scientists in the fields of chemistry, fluid dynamics, neurophysiology, inorganic chemistry, and astrophysics. The Royal Society awards medals to Sir Cyril Hinshelwood, Professor D. M. Newitt, Professor S. Chandrasekhar, Sir John Eccles, and Professor H. J. Emeleus for their significant work in their respective fields.
